Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an abuse of democratic norms and a step towards totalitarianism.
The terms 'misinformation', 'disinformation', and 'harmful' are vague and open to broad interpretation.
The bill formalizes government control over social media content, which was previously informal.
The legislation is perceived as a threat to free speech and expression.
The bill excludes mainstream media and educational institutions from censorship, which is viewed as hypocritical.
Notable Quotes: This bill is a grotesque abuse of every democratic norm and represents a dangerous lurch down the path to totalitarianism which all Australians should oppose.
A digital platform is merely a modern version of the public forum in the town square.
This government’s behaviour is reminiscent of Hitler’s ascendancy to power in the 1930s.
